intro: Adesmia carnosa, commonly known as the hairy adesmia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its hairy stems and leaves. It produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Adesmia carnosa is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
